newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: New Toyo says signs letter for China carton plant.
newsitem.headline: New Toyo says signs letter for China carton plant.

text.p: Paper products and packaging materials maker New Toyo International Holdings Ltd said on Tuesday it has signed a letter of intent to set up a plant in China to manufacture corrugated paper cartons.

New Toyo said in a statement that total investment for the project in the Wuhu Development Zone would be about US$3.5 million and annual production volume is estimated at 24,000 tonnes once the plant is in full operation.
The letter of intent was signed with the management committee of the Wuhu Economic and Technological Development Zone.
New Toyo launched an initial public offering for a listing on the Stock Exchange of Singapore main board on March 19. The offer closes on April 2.
